to me the fact that a point in the upper left side of a snowflake branches (macroscopically) exactly like a point in the lower right side is a plain miracle. The overlap of EM fields of countless atoms determine the likelyhood of a branch and the type of the branch in a specific point and the fact that the symmetry is maintained at such macroscale is astonishing. I cannot wrap my mind around it. Termal jigling, crystal offsets, pressure/temperature/humidity differentials across the snowflake... when you account for those you should sink quickly into caos, such precise symmetry of the surface tension and the overall EM strenght and orientation cannot be maintained... and, instead, it is.
If anything, I think science just made snowflakes more fascinating!

Why is "Scientist Ruins Winter For Everyone" in the title?

Actually the time lapse shows another cool phenomenon called Wegener–Bergeron–Findeisen process. Look at the tiny droplets around the flakes vanish as the crystal grows. It's caused by equilibrium vapor pressure difference between liquid and solid phase of water, with the prior one has higher saturated vapor pressure. Also, the energy barrier is higher for ice crystals than water droplets to form from scratch, which is called nucleation process. Thus you may see supercooled water droplets everywhere with only a few crystals.

I disliked this video because it is attempting to create a myth. It is completely false that 2 snowflakes are identical. Even 2 that 'look' identical is a myth.

In the examples shown, I could easily and clearly see significant differences between the two 'perfect' copies...with my naked eye.

So let me break it down...

Even IF two snowflakes 'looked' identical ... even under the closest scrutiny of an electron microscope... they would still be completely different ... because the electrons whizzing around are all in different unpredictable locations. For this reason...they are physically NEVER going to be identical. No more than two coins are identical.

Secondly, even if magically there was physical identicality, they are both completely different...otherwise, they would be the same thing. Each particle of the snowflake is different, with a different history. This is a major contributor to why in all the history of the Universe from now and forever, NO TWO SNOWFLAKES ARE THE SAME.

These subtle yet significant differences are also that which make it a fact that no two humans ever have been or will be identical. Nor, in fact, is anything that exists identical.

This video is attempting to create a false myth, therefore, I disliked it.
